articles.author: Jennifer Chu
articles.title: A carbon-lite atmosphere could be a sign of water and life on other terrestrial planets, study finds - Phys.org
articles.description: Scientists at MIT, the University of Birmingham, and elsewhere say that astronomers' best chance of finding liquid water, and even life on other planets, is to look for the absence, rather than the presence, of a chemical feature in their atmospheres.
